block.p: Katherine Blackburne Finn, a daughter of Catherine and Harold Finn III of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Grant Patrick Felgenhauer, a son of Patricia and Neil Felgenhauer of Spokane, Wash. The Rev. Michael R. Moynihan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.
The bride, 24, and the bridegroom, 25, met at Yale University, where she received a bachelor's degree in history and he a bachelor's degree in economics and Russian.

Katherine Blackburne Finn, a daughter of Catherine and Harold Finn III of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Grant Patrick Felgenhauer, a son of Patricia and Neil Felgenhauer of Spokane, Wash. The Rev. Michael R. Moynihan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.
The bride, 24, and the bridegroom, 25, met at Yale University, where she received a bachelor's degree in history and he a bachelor's degree in economics and Russian.
Ms. Felgenhauer, who is known as Kelly, is a paralegal in the Manhattan district attorney's office. Her father is a partner in Finn Dixon & Herling, a law firm in Stamford, Conn.
The bride's grandfather Wilford R. Young of Palm City, Fla., retired as vice chairman and general counsel of Texaco, the oil company.
Mr. Felgenhauer, 25, is recently completed his second-year at at Columbia University Law School. His father is an editor and a copy desk chief at The Spokesman-Review, a daily newspaper in Spokane.
The bridegroom's mother teaches the fourth grade at the Finch Elementary School, which is also in Spokane.
